result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nina Marie Martinez

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Name Change Order; Received and Filed.

Defendant Nina Marie Martinez appeared by video.  Attorney Christian Thomas appeared by video for Nina Marie Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time to review. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nina Marie Martinez appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Christian Thomas to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning on 1/1/2023 and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment. 
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nina Marie Martinez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/12/22 @ 2:30p
